content.raw: As it stands, it seems the behavior of this kinematic teleportation is undefined in regards to how the other kinematic properties should be handled. What if we add the flag and update the existing implementations of `SetPosition` to throw an exception (or indicate an error in some other way) when the type of teleportation requested is not how the particular physics engine implemented it? That would lead to a more well defined behavior overall, without requiring functional changes to existing code beyond some refactoring.
